title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: outlines propose change glysmith. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("glycoverse/glysmith", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: Please note glysmith project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with glysmith
text: Thanks using glysmith! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with glysmith
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty incredible ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with glysmith
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with glysmith
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

text: Bin Fu. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

what: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
title: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
text: One Ring rule . — Lord Rings  overwhelmed complexity glycoverse? Imagine package, performing analysis need, PCA, DEA, enrichment, even advanced glycan derived trait analysis, just one line code. Try glysmith! Perform comprehensive analysis pipeline one function call.

title: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
text: [!NOTE] package still development may stable. can install development version glysmith GitHub :

title: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
code: library(glyread) library(glysmith)  exp <- read_pglyco3("pglyco3_result.txt", sample_info = "sample_info.csv")  # One line of code for the comprehensive analysis pipeline result <- forge_analysis(exp)  # One line of code to save the results quench_result(result, "path/to/save")  # One line of code to generate a report polish_report(result, "report.html")

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
text: blueprint list steps executed order.

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
Create a Blueprint — blueprint
text: ... One step objects.

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
text: blueprint object.

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
code: blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_pca(),   step_dea_limma(),  # this comma is ok ) #>  #> ── Blueprint (3 steps) ── #>  #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma()

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: blueprint contains following steps: step_preprocess(): Preprocess data using glyclean::auto_clean(). step_ident_overview(): Summarize experiment using glyexp::summarize_experiment(). step_pca(): Principal component analysis using glystats::gly_pca(), plot PCA using glyvis::plot_pca(). step_dea_limma(): Differential analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). step_volcano(): Plot volcano plot using glyvis::plot_volcano(). step_sig_enrich_go(): Perform GO enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). step_sig_enrich_kegg(): Perform KEGG enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(). step_sig_enrich_reactome(): Perform Reactome enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). step_derive_traits(): Derive traits using glydet::derive_traits(). step_dea_limma(= "trait_exp"): Differential trait analysis using glystats::gly_limma().

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
code: blueprint_default(preprocess = TRUE, enrich = TRUE, traits = TRUE)

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: preprocess Whether include step_preprocess(). enrich Whether include enrichment steps, .e. step_sig_enrich_go(), step_sig_enrich_kegg(), step_sig_enrich_reactome(). traits Whether include derived trait analysis steps, .e. step_derive_traits() step_dea_limma(= "trait_exp").

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: glysmith_blueprint object.

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
code: blueprint_default() #>  #> ── Blueprint (10 steps) ── #>  #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_ident_overview() #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma() #> • step_volcano() #> • step_sig_enrich_go() #> • step_sig_enrich_kegg() #> • step_sig_enrich_reactome() #> • step_derive_traits() #> • step_dea_limma(on = "trait_exp")

Error:  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Preprocessing [286ms] #>  #> ℹ Identification overview #> ✔ Identification overview [123ms] #>  #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ! `step_pca()` failed. Skipping... Error: cannot rescale a constant/zero column to unit variance #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ✔ Principal component analysis [14ms] #>  #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> Warning: Partial NA coefficients for 7 probe(s) #> ✔ Differential expression analysis (limma) [229ms] #>  #> ℹ Volcano plot #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the EnhancedVolcano package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors. #> Warning: The `size` argument of `element_line()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use the `linewidth` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the EnhancedVolcano package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors. #> ✔ Volcano plot [746ms] #>  #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_go()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_kegg()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_reactome()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment. #> ℹ Derived trait calculation #> ✔ Derived trait calculation [8.3s] #>  #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential trait analysis (limma) [85ms] #>  cast_exp(result) #>  #> ── Glycomics Experiment ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Expression matrix: 144 samples, 67 variables #> ℹ Sample information fields: group <fct> #> ℹ Variable information fields: glycan_composition <comp>, glycan_structure <struct> cast_table(result, "summary") #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   item            n #>   <chr>       <int> #> 1 composition    67 #> 2 structure      67

what: Forge an Analysis for Group Comparison — forge_analysis
title: Forge an Analysis for Group Comparison — forge_analysis
text: function performs comprehensive analysis group comparison.

title: Forge an Analysis for Group Comparison — forge_analysis
Forge an Analysis for Group Comparison — forge_analysis
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object. blueprint glysmith_blueprint object. Default blueprint_default(). group_col Column name group information sample information. Used various analyses. Default "group". ... Additional arguments passed underlying functions. Use format step_id.pkg.func.arg (step-scoped). example, want pass argument p_adj_method = "BH" glystats::gly_limma() step_dea_limma(), set dea.glystats.gly_limma.p_adj_method = "BH". pass batch_col glyclean::auto_clean() step_preprocess(), set preprocess.glyclean.auto_clean.batch_col = "batch". Note arguments group column specification controlled group_col argument, passed ....

title: Forge an Analysis for Group Comparison — forge_analysis
text: glysmith_result object, following components: exp: experiment preprocessing. plots: named list ggplot objects. tables: named list tibbles. meta: named list metadata. Currently two elements: explanation: named character vector list explanations plot table, keys like tables$summary plots$pca. steps: character vector steps analysis.

title: Forge an Analysis for Group Comparison — forge_analysis
code: exp <- glyexp::real_experiment2 result <- forge_analysis(exp) #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Removing variables with too many missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. what: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
title: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
text: glysmith provides high-level, end--end workflows glycomics glycoproteomics data analysis within glycoverse ecosystem. acts orchestrator integrates data cleaning, quality control, derived trait computation, motif detection, statistical testing, visualization unified, one-command analytical pipelines. Built top experiment() data container domain-knowledge-aware infrastructure provided glyclean, glydet, glymotif, glystats, glyvis, related packages, glysmith enables users quickly forge polished tables, figures, analysis reports suitable publication. package designed reproducibility ease use, allowing novice advanced users obtain standardized structure-aware results minimal code retaining full flexibility customization.

title: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
text: Maintainer: Bin Fu 23110220018@m.fudan.edu.cn (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
text: Save processed experiment, plots tables glysmith result object directory. README.md file also generated describe saved outputs, based metadata x$meta.

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
code: quench_result(   x,   dir,   plot_ext = "pdf",   table_ext = "csv",   plot_width = 5,   plot_height = 5 )

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
text: x glysmith result object. dir directory save result. plot_ext extension plot files. Either "pdf", "png" "svg". Default "pdf". table_ext extension table files. Either "csv" "tsv". Default "csv". plot_width width plot inches. Default 5. plot_height height plot inches. Default 5.

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
text: glysmith result object.

what: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Run differential analysis using ANOVA via glystats::gly_anova(). default, runs DEA main experiment (exp), can configured run derived traits (trait_exp) experiment objects.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Name experiment data ctx$data run analysis . Default "exp" differential expression analysis. Use "trait_exp" differential trait analysis. ... Step-specific arguments passed glystats::gly_anova(). Use format pkg.func.arg.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Data required: Depends parameter (default: exp) Data generated: dea_res: DEA results (= "exp", default) dta_res: DTA results (= "trait_exp") Tables generated: dea_main_test, dea_post_hoc_test: Tables containing results (= "exp", default) dta_main_test, dta_post_hoc_test: Tables containing results (= "trait_exp")

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
code: step_dea_anova() #> <step "step_dea_anova()"> Differential expression analysis (anova) step_dea_anova(on = "trait_exp")  # Differential trait analysis #> <step "step_dea_anova(on = \"trait_exp\")"> Differential trait analysis (anova)

text: ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_pca(glystats.gly_pca.center = FALSE).

text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
text: Data required: exp: experiment run PCA Tables generated: pca_samples: table containing PCA scores sample pca_variables: table containing PCA loadings variable pca_eigenvalues: table containing PCA eigenvalues Plots generated: pca: PCA plot colored group

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: Preprocess experiment using glyclean::auto_clean(). usually first step, can omitted experiment already preprocessed.

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_preprocess(glyclean.auto_clean.remove_preset = "discovery").

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: Data required: exp: experiment preprocess Data generated: raw_exp: raw experiment (previous exp, saved reference) step special silently overwrites exp data preprocessed experiment. ensures matter preprocessing performed , "active" experiment always key exp. previous exp saved raw_exp reference.

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess

what: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: Perform GO enrichment analysis differentially expressed variables using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). step requires one DEA steps run. execute glycoproteomics experiments. Use genes OrgDb background.

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: universe universe (background) use enrichment analysis. One "" (genes OrgDb), "detected" (detected variables exp). ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_sig_enrich_go(glystats.gly_enrich_go.p_adj_method = "BH").

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform GO enrichment analysis dea_res: DEA results glystats::gly_limma() Tables generated: go_enrich: table containing GO enrichment results.

what: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
text: write_blueprint() saves blueprint RDS file. read_blueprint() loads blueprint RDS file.

title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
text: bp blueprint(). file character string giving name file save load .

title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
text: Invisibly returns blueprint object.

title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
code: bp <- blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_pca(),   step_dea_limma(), ) write_blueprint(bp, tempfile(fileext = ".rds"))
